speaker: Frasier
text: You know Niles, I think I'm going to have a dinner party. Care to co-host?

speaker: Niles
text: [_stops playing_] I love the idea, what's the occasion?

speaker: Frasier
text: I got the idea last night when we bumped into Jean and Hollis Ashley at the symphony, I've always wanted to get to know them better.

speaker: Niles
text: Me too, they're such a charming couple: they remind me of Maris and me when we were happy. [_pours himself a drink_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_doorbell_] Really?  I must have been sick that day!  _Frasier answers the door: It's Roz wearing an elegant long dress. She is carrying a red dress in a bag._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_delighted_] Oh, well Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that your dry cleaning?

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's Daphne's.  Alice spit up on her dress so I had to have it dry-cleaned for her.  I also had to buy her new shoes and detail her car, I've never seen a kid so sick!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters from bedroom in dressing gown_] Hey Roz, you look gorgeous.

speaker: Roz
text: How much time do we have?

speaker: Daphne
text: Twenty minutes.  I better get changed.

speaker: Niles
text: Where are you going?

speaker: Roz
text: Daphne has friends at the British Consulate and they're having a big reception tonight, she has an invitation.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_excited_] Yes, who knows Roz?  Maybe you'll meet some English lord who'll make you a lady.

speaker: Niles
text: I think at this point it would take the actual Lord to make her a lady.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well let's pick a date for our party. [_picks up book_] Got your book?

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: The 1st is no good.

speaker: Niles
text: No: wine club.  The second?

speaker: Frasier
text: Library fundraiser.  Third?

speaker: Niles
text: No.  Fourth, fifth, sixth?

speaker: Frasier
text: No. [_turns page_] No, no, no.

speaker: Niles
text: What about the 11th?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, concert tickets.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't have that marked.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm taking a date.

speaker: Niles
text: Well isn't that nice. [_writes in_] 11th, "expect desperate last minute call from F."  Anything the next week?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no... [_notices_] Oh, I've got the 19th.

speaker: Niles
text: [_excited_] I've got the 19th!

speaker: Frasier
text: The 19th it is then.

speaker: Niles
text: Huzzah!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, boys.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What's up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well actually, after an unusually protracted game of dueling date books, Niles and I have set a mutually acceptable evening for an intime soiree. [_pause_] We're having a dinner party!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sounds good! Any date but the 19th!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what is wrong with the 19th?

speaker: Martin
text: My poker game's here that night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can't you reschedule it?

speaker: Martin
text: [_angry_] No!  It's always the third Saturday of the month and everybody shows.  Jimmy once postponed his daughter's wedding just so that he could be here, and if you ever saw his daughter you'd know how risky that was.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you know we wouldn't ask if there was any other date that worked!

speaker: Martin
text: Do you really expect me to give up my game so you can have one of your intime soirees?

speaker: Niles
text: I knew he knew what that meant!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, couldn't you at least make a few calls? [_thinking_] I tell you what, if you can change the day - I'll cover your losses that night.

speaker: Martin
text: [_swayed a little_] Well all right, I'll try.  But you know, these guys live pretty busy lives - I can't always get in touch with them.

speaker: Niles
text: Let's hope that dog track has a PA system.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, Niles, back to our party... got any thoughts on a caterer?

speaker: Niles
text: [_excited_] Well... Cornell Evans.  He's pricey but he's the best.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's book him. [_goes to phone_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh marvelous!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to phone_] Oh, I'm sorry Dad, I didn't know you were on the line. [_hangs up_] _Daphne and Roz walk out of the bedroom. Daphne is now wearing the red dress._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my goodness.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well we're off to the ball, don't wait up for us. [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, wait, wait, wait, wait, there's something on the back of your dress.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks round_] Oh my God, it looks like bleach or something! The dry cleaner must have done it!

speaker: Roz
text: I saw it, it's nothing.

speaker: Daphne
text: You saw it?!

speaker: Roz
text: Don't worry, it's hardly noticeable.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_distraught_] Dr. Crane noticed it!

speaker: Roz
text: That's because he's always looking at your...

speaker: Niles
text: [_quickly_] Roz!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I can't go now!

speaker: Roz
text: Why not?!

speaker: Daphne
text: This is the only formal dress I've got.

speaker: Roz
text: Wait!  I've got the rest of my dry cleaning down in the car, I bet I have something you can wear, I'll be right back.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking out a tissue and wetting it_] You know Daphne, I bet I would be able to get that out for you. [_goes to touch it_]

speaker: Daphne
text: No!  The cleaner's spoiled it, he can damn well fix it! [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: It would just take...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on cellular_] Can I speak to Cornell, please?  Yes, of course I'll hold.

speaker: Niles
text: [_going to room again_] Daphne, I mean it, if I just had a toothbrush and a jeweler's...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  _Niles walks back to the main room with his head low.  A few minutes later Frasier is still on his cellular._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] How long is he going to keep me on hold!

speaker: Niles
text: [_Roz enters_] Hey Roz, did you find any kind of thing...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Hello Cornell, yes Frasier Crane here.  Listen, I'm hoping that you're not booked on the 19th.  Oh Lord, yes I understand that... yes, same to you.  Alright, bye-bye. [_puts phone down_] Damn!  Don't you know it, the only date he's got free is the 11th.  Damn those concert tickets!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know who might be available: Tyler Wilkins.

speaker: Frasier
text: Doesn't he work with Cornell?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear God, no.  They are mortal enemies: they were catering a seafood banquet when Cornell flew into a rage because Tyler had ordered Mahi Mahi instead of Ahi.  Of course, Tyler blamed it on Cornell's stutter and they haven't spoken since. [_into phone_] Tyler, Niles Crane, yes.  I was wondering if you were available on the 19th?  Wonderful, dinner for... 10.  That's great, I'll call you later on and we'll discuss the menu. Thanks, bye-bye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That is wonderful, alright, [_writing list_] now you, me and the fabulous Ashbys.  That leaves six chairs to fill.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we'll have to have Joan and Ted Birkin, that's a no- brainer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Technically that's two no-brainers, forget the Birkins.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait a minute, you can't just steamroll over me, I want the Birkins!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I do!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, we each have a right to blackball, let's say, three guests.  We will each get an equal voice.

speaker: Niles
text: That's fair enough.  _Frasier brings over the nut tray. Niles gets three nuts and Frasier gets three nuts.  Frasier then places a bowl on the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: That's three for me and three for you.  And just to get the blackball rolling... [_throws one in bowl_] Bye-bye, Birkins!

speaker: Niles
text: What about John and Carol Peterson, everyone loves them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not everyone! [_throws his second in bowl_] Blackball!

speaker: Niles
text: Why?!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, we never question the blackball.  We just bow to its will.

speaker: Niles
text: Fine, Nina and Arch Duncan.

speaker: Frasier
text: "The Drunken Duncans?!"  Have you lost your... [_realizes_] Wait a minute.  You loathe the Duncans, you just want me to waste a blackball.

speaker: Niles
text: That's insane, I adore the Duncans.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, perhaps I misjudged them.  Very well Niles, the Duncans it is. [_slowly writing_] Nina and Arch...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, stop it, they're hideous! [_throws in his first_] Blackball! What about the Walburts?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I like the Walburts.

speaker: Niles
text: Finally.  Gordons?

speaker: Frasier
text: I love the Gordons, now we're rolling.

speaker: Niles
text: How about the DiFalcos?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_throws in last_] Blackball!  She is a twit.  How about the Whitneys?

speaker: Niles
text: [_throws in second_] Blackball!  He's a dolt. [_Frasier begins eating another nut_] Cromwells?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_throws in nut_] Blackball!

speaker: Niles
text: Look, if you're gonna... [_notices it wasn't official_] Wait a minute, you're out of blackballs... this is a dried-up old fig!

speaker: Frasier
text: So is Lucy Cromwell, I don't want her at my party.

speaker: Niles
text: The Cromwell's are in - the guest list is complete.  Now let's start calling everyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes - starting with our guests of honor: the Ashbys. [_dials then in phone_] Hello Hollis, Frasier Crane calling. Listen, Niles and I are planning on having a dinner party on the 19th and... oh. [_to Niles_] They're leaving to Africa on the 19th. [_into phone_] Oh, gee that's a shame.  We were sorta building the evening around you.  Oh! [_to Niles_] They've got the 11th free.

speaker: Niles
text: No good, we've got that concert.

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't ask you to that. [_to phone_] The 11th should be just fine.  Oh no, they've got a conflict.  Oh, well that's no problem - they were our very next call.  We absolutely adore the Duncans.  All right, we'll see you then. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Niles
text: Not the drunken Duncans?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry Niles, they've got plans for the Ashbys on the 11th, so they're invited too.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I want my blackball back. [_takes it_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, the blackball was dropped, it can never be...

speaker: Niles
text: Shut up!

speaker: Frasier
text: At least we're getting the Ashbys - in fact, you know what? There's an additional plus - seeing as we're changing our plans to the 11th, it means Cornell can cater.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh quick, you call Cornell, I'll call Tyler and tell him we're canceling. [_into phone_] Tyler.  It's Niles Crane again.  Yes, listen, it turns out we're not going to need you on the 19th.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Yes, Cornell please.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, we're not going with someone else.  Cornell?! [_laughs_] What gave you that idea?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Cornell, Frasier Crane.  Listen, we've changed our party plans and...  _Niles and Frasier continue chatting to the two enemy chefs.  Niles walks towards Frasier and vice versa, however they brush past each other and drop their mobiles.  They don't know who's phone is who's, however Frasier has an idea._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smelling phone_] This one's mine, I can smell my cologne!  _They begin talking into the phone - Niles acts as if he's talking to Tyler and Frasier seems to be talking to Cornell. However they both stop, realize, then switch phones.  However by this time the angry chefs have hung up._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thanks to your keen sense of smell, we've lost both caterers.  I suppose we can always get Kiki Price.

speaker: Frasier
text: She still in business?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, they dropped the charges!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_delighted_] Oh.  I better phone the Duncans, hope we can catch them before "Happy Hour"! [_dials then into phone_] Hello, Nina. [_aside_] Too late! [_into phone_] Frasier Crane calling.  Listen, Niles and I are having the Ashbys over and a few other people for a dinner and we were hoping that you could join us on the 11th... Don't cry, Nina, please.  Yes, well, I've always loved you too.  What?  Joaquin?  Joaquin is coming in from Argentina, you'd like him to, to join us... well?

speaker: Niles
text: [_whispers excitedly_] Joaquin?!  Joaquin Warens, he's the conductor of the Buenos Aires Philharmonic.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] My God, that's right, they were just down there, they must have met him. [_to Nina_] We would love to have Joaquin join us!  Oh, that's splendid.  Alright, right, then we'll see you on the 11th.  The 11th.  Alright, take two swizzle sticks and stand them up side by side.  Eleven, that's right.

speaker: Niles
text: We've got Joaquin! [_excited_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, don't cry for me, Arch & Nina!  Alright, let's see, we've got the Duncans and Joaquin, and that means we're going to have to cut out two couples.  Well, the Cromwells and the...

speaker: Niles
text: Gordons!

speaker: Frasier
text: The Gordons.  That leaves us short by one, we need a single female.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Roz, perfect timing.

speaker: Roz
text: What's up?

speaker: Niles
text: We're having a dinner party and we need an interesting single woman. [_she smiles_] Do you know anybody?  We're desperate!

speaker: Roz
text: [_angrily she enters the kitchen_] Excuse me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Naturally we thought of you first, Roz, but this isn't really your kind of crowd.

speaker: Roz
text: What?  Sophisticated, cultured, is that why you don't think I'd fit in with your snooty elitist friends, I'm not genteel enough?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: Now Roz, my ass.  I'm just as refined as you are.  Shut up, Niles!  _Roz exits to Daphne's bedroom as Martin enters from his with some news._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I hope you're satisfied.  I got everyone to change. We're gonna have it on the 11th.

speaker: Frasier
text: The 11th?!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and it wasn't easy either, Mel had to reschedule his polyp surgery.

speaker: Niles
text: Well Dad, you are really going to laugh at this.  Frasier and I rescheduled our dinner party for the 11th. [_laughs_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_mad_] I'm not changing it back!  I'm not!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now Dad, I would never even consider asking you to do such a thing.  I tell you what, there's no reason why we can't hold both parties simultaneously.  The apartment's certainly big enough.

speaker: Martin
text: [_smugly_] I know what you're trying to do, and it won't work!

speaker: Frasier
text: What, dad?  I'm serious, no, no, we can share the buffet table and we can even have the harpist learn a couple of Bobby Darin tunes for your crowd!

speaker: Martin
text: I can stand it if you can! [_smug smile_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, we will have to dim the lights at one point. You see, Nina Duncan always insists on sharing her extensive collection of slides from the summer she danced Agamemmnom at Jacob's Pillow.

speaker: Martin
text: [_smug smile until he breaks_] All right, I'll change it. [_leaves to bedroom_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] You call Kiki, and the Walburts.  And I'll talk to Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm on it!  _Meanwhile, in Daphne's bedroom, Roz and Daphne are searching through clothes.  Daphne is holding clothes up to her._

speaker: Roz
text: [_impatient_] Come on, pick something!

speaker: Daphne
text: Pick what?! [_throws normal dress down_] This one isn't dressy enough! [_throws a blue dress down_] This one doesn't fit. [_picks up a glittery blue dress which covers only everything between the cleavage and the thighs_] And this one, well, it's hardly appropriate for a posh cocktail reception!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_walks in_] Excuse me, Roz, listen, I just came to apologize.

speaker: Roz
text: [_angry_] Whatever!

speaker: Daphne
text: What happened?

speaker: Roz
text: He said I wasn't classy enough to come to his fancy dinner party!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you know I didn't mean that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, get in line.  I've lived here for six years and the only time I'm asked to that table is when I'm holding a freakin' serving spoon!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just a silly dinner party, what's everyone getting so upset about?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, let's just go. [_picks up showy glittery dress_] Oh, I suppose this color might look nice on me after all.

speaker: Niles
text: [_enters_] I've left messages for Kiki and the Walburts.

speaker: Roz
text: Could you two please leave, so Daphne can change!

speaker: Niles
text: [_notices Daphne's dress_] Daphne, you're not actually going out in that, are you? [_laughs politely_]

speaker: Daphne
text: That's it, I'm staying home.

speaker: Roz
text: No, just try it, we can accessorize it.

speaker: Niles
text: With what?!  A lamp post and a public defender?! _Roz pushes Niles and Frasier out of the door.  As they enter the main room they hear a beep and whirring noise from the answering machine._

speaker: Frasier
text: Lord, was that the answering machine? [_listens to message_]

speaker: Allison
text: [_from phone_] Hi, it's Allison Walburt.  And, yes, count us in for the 11th.  Looking forward to it, bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's wonderful, I so enjoy the Walburts.  _However, it seems the tape hasn't finished yet - Allison's left the phone of the hook._

speaker: Harry
text: [_from phone_] Who was that?

speaker: Allison
text: [_from phone_] We just got invited to a dinner party at Dr. Crane's.

speaker: Harry
text: Which Dr. Crane?

speaker: Allison
text: Does it matter?  You get the one, you get that other one. Personally, I think the whole arrangement's a little...

speaker: Harry
text: Is that thing off the hook?

speaker: Allison
text: Oh my God! [_hangs up_]  _Frasier and Niles look at each other as they switch it off.  End Of Act One (Time: 13:15)  Act Two. The scene resumes where it left off.  Frasier and Niles have just switched off the answer phone._

speaker: Niles
text: What you suppose she meant by that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Obviously, she thinks we're always together.  That we're some sort of "couple."

speaker: Niles
text: That's ridiculous, we spend lots of times apart. [_takes a bit of fluff from Frasier's jacket like a wife would do to her husband_] Besides, who is she to talk?  Look at her and Harry - they go everywhere together.

speaker: Frasier
text: They're married, Niles!  Still, there's no reason for her to call us odd!

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, she never called us odd - listen.

speaker: Allison
text: Does it matter?  You get the one, you get that other one. Personally, I think the whole arrangement's a little...

speaker: Harry
text: Is that thing off the hook?

speaker: Allison
text: Oh my God! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Niles
text: You see, she never said odd - we're getting upset over nothing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing?!  Is there a good end to that sentence?! "Personally, I think the whole arrangement is a little..."  What?!  Charming?!

speaker: Niles
text: Really, will you stop overreacting?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps she has a point.  Ever since your divorce you have become more and more attached to me.  Maybe that's why she said what she said.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: You get Frasier, you get that Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: She didn't say that.  She said "you get the one, you get that other one."  What makes you think that you're the one and I'm that other one?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I am the one giving the party, and you are that other one!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm the one that invited her, so that makes you that other one!

speaker: Niles
text: This is absurd!  Why don't we just call Allison up and ask her what she thinks is so strange about us?  We can both get her on an extension.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Better yet, why don't we just get on a bicycle built for two, ride over there and ask her what she thinks is so strange about us! _The phone goes which stops them in their tracks.  Frasier picks it up -- it's Nina Duncan - so he makes a "drunk" sign._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on phone_] Hello.  Yes, hello Nina.  Alright, what can I do for you?  No, no, dear, you called me.  Oh yes, Joaquin can only eat certain foods - well, yes I'd be glad to accommodate them.  Let's see, alright... [_Niles writes it down_] Rice, beans, jerked beef.  Any particular reason?  I see. Interesting.  OK.  Bye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Niles
text: Why is Joaquin on such a strict diet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because the Joaquin they're bringing to dinner is... [_falls on sofa_] ...their foster child!  From a tiny village on the pompus.  He speaks no English and he gets nauseated when he eats American food!

speaker: Niles
text: [_confused_] So, he's not the conductor of the Buenos Aires Philharmonic?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you are so that other one! [_calming down_] Where are we going to find someone to babysit a nine year old child? _At this moment, again in perfect timing, Roz walks on as she finishes shouting to an off-stage Daphne:_

speaker: Roz
text: Quit your blubbering and just pick something, dammit!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz-

speaker: Roz
text: Now what?!

speaker: Frasier
text: You were right.  You know, you would be a welcome addition to any party.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you don't have to say that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No honestly, Niles and I want you to join us for dinner.

speaker: Roz
text: You mean it?

speaker: Frasier
text: In fact, we're having someone who might make a very interesting dinner companion for you.

speaker: Roz
text: He's not some stuffy old coot, is he?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no..

speaker: Niles
text: [_truthful_] Young!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, very young!

speaker: Roz
text: OK, thanks!

speaker: Frasier
text: Not exactly my wish list, but at least we've got the Ashbys.

speaker: Niles
text: Allison Walburt can say what she wants, why should we care a whit about what anybody else thinks.  Am I right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely! [_to Martin_] Dad, do you think we're odd?!

speaker: Martin
text: [_tactical_] No, you're not odd.  You're just special!  Your mother told me that when you were kids and I still believe it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but do you think we spend too much time together?

speaker: Martin
text: You're close, lots of brothers are close.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I suppose you're right about that.  The Gershwins, the Wright Brothers...

speaker: Niles
text: I told you we were getting upset over nothing.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] Course, then there were the Collier brothers!

speaker: Niles
text: Collier brothers?

speaker: Martin
text: Couple of nuttos that shared an apartment in New York their whole lives.  They even built a maze out of newspapers in there that only they knew how to get through.  They collapsed on one of them and the other one just sat there with the dead body until the neighbors complained about the smell! [_laughs_] Pretty crazy story. [_gets beer_] You recycle right, Niles? [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, maybe it wouldn't be the worst idea if we went our own ways a bit more.

speaker: Niles
text: It's possible we have grown a tad dependent on one another. [_again takes a bit out of Frasier's jacket_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps this is just the warning we need.  Today we're planning a dinner party... tomorrow we're wearing matching pajamas and washing each other's hair!  Let's face it, Niles, we are one stone's throw away from becoming the neighborhood kooks!  Right down to the local children ringing our doorbell and running away.

speaker: Niles
text: Now Frasier, you are letting your imagination get the better of you.  Come on, let's go make a seating chart.

speaker: Frasier
text: You always know how to cheer me up.  _Frasier and Niles enter the main room as Daphne enters from her room in Roz's dress._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Daphne, isn't that Roz's dress?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, it was really the only thing that looked good on me. [_calling_] Come on, Roz, we don't want to be late!

speaker: Daphne
text: Doesn't she look beautiful!

speaker: Roz
text: [_angry_] Oh, shut it, Daphne!  I know you think I look like a hooker.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I said it made me look like a hooker.  On you... well, it works. _As Roz storms out of the apartment, Daphne follows her and closes the door.  The phone goes and Frasier answers._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on phone_] Hello?  Yes, yes.  Oh Lord, I'm so sorry you can't make it.  That's all right.  Yes, some other time.  Goodbye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Niles
text: Please not the Ashbys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Family emergency.  Apparently it's so urgent they didn't have time to think up a plausible excuse!

speaker: Niles
text: So where does that leave us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's see... we have a third-rate caterer with a record, a couple of lushes, a couple who think we're both nutcases, an Argentine wild child and Roz! [_throws down list_] Dinner is served!

speaker: Niles
text: [_realizing_] I still have one blackball left.

speaker: Frasier
text: At this point I don't think one is going to make any difference.

speaker: Niles
text: It will to me, I'm using it on myself. [_black balls himself_] Blackball!  _However, Frasier is angry with him and claims you cannot blackball yourself.  They begin grappling at the bowl until all the balls shoot out.  Frasier steadies himself._

speaker: Frasier
text: We are the Collier brothers!  Why don't we just face the inevitable: let us just cancel the whole damn thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course, canceling the party twenty minutes later - people'll think we're strange!

speaker: Frasier
text: Frankly, I'm sick and tired about giving a damn about what other people think.  You know, most of them are one ball away from not being here in the first place.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.  So we spend a lot of time together, so what? I enjoy it.

speaker: Frasier
text: So do I, Niles.  You know, why don't we make those calls tomorrow to cancel?  I'm famished, why don't we just head over to "Companion" for dinner, my treat.

speaker: Niles
text: [_excited_] You're on. [_laughing_] Unless you think it's too odd to have dinner together. [_gets coat_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] I don't think we're in any danger of that.  If our relationship became truly odd I think we're both intelligent enough to recognize the signs. _The doorbell sounds so they go to answer it.  There is nobody there, but a distant sound of children giggling.  Niles, recognizing the signs, decides to forget dinner and just go home.  End Of Act Two. (Time: 21:33)_
